actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 2, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Carter (GA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 385
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 307).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4423 — "To continue the pause on disbursements and new financing commitments to the Government of Burma."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 386
actions-list.actionItem: 0, 1 Present (Roll no. 306).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5348 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for the reissuance of social security account numbers to young children in cases where confidentiality has been compromised."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4430.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4430 — "To lower the aggregate market value of voting and non-voting common equity necessary for an issuer to qualify as a well-known seasoned issuer."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4431.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4431 — "To amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 with respect to the definition of qualifying venture capital funds, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4429.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4429 — "To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to revise the definition of a qualifying investment, for purposes of the exemption from registration for venture capital fund advisers under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, to include an equity security issued by a qualifying portfolio company and to include an investment in another venture capital fund, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3716.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3716 — "To amend the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to require reports on the use of the systemic risk authority applicable to winding up a failed insured depository institution, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4423.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4423 — "To continue the pause on disbursements and new financing commitments to the Government of Burma."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 225.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Davidson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 225 — "To require the Inspector General of the Department of Housing and Urban Development to testify before the Congress annually, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5349.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5349 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to improve services provided to taxpayers by the Internal Revenue Service by providing greater judicial review."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5346.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5346 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reform certain penalty and interest provisions."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5348.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5348 — "To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for the reissuance of social security account numbers to young children in cases where confidentiality has been compromised."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5345.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5345 — "To amend title VII of the Social Security Act to provide for a single point of contact at the Social Security Administration for individuals who are victims of identity theft."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5284.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5284 — "To require the Social Security Administration to make changes to the social security terminology used in the rules, regulation, guidance, or other materials of the Administration."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4313.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Smith (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4313 — "To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend acute hospital care at home waiver flexibilities, and to require an additional study and report on such flexibilities."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1262.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Carter (GA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1262 — "To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act with respect to molecularly targeted pediatric cancer investigations, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 616.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 616 — "To amend title 36, United States Code, to revise the Federal charter for the Foundation of the Federal Bar Association."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 176.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. McClintock moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 176 — "To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act with respect to aliens who carried out, participated in, planned, financed, supported, or otherwise facilitated the attacks against Israel."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2159.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Roy moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2159 — "To direct the Attorney General of the United States to submit to the Congress a report on Federal criminal offenses, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4323.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4323 — "To provide for the vacating of certain convictions and expungement of certain arrests of victims of human trafficking."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2066.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2066 — "To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to exclude from the limit on leverage certain amounts invested in smaller enterprises located in rural or low-income areas and small businesses in critical technology areas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4549.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4549 — "To amend the Small Business Act to clarify the responsibilities of the Office of Rural Affairs of the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4495.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4495 — "To extend the statute of limitations for fraud under certain pandemic programs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4491.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4491 — "To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to implement certain recommendations relating to information technology modernization, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3174.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3174 — "To increase loan limits for loans made to small manufacturers, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Cisneros to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 1.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Virginia Foxx to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
